quizzes.npcDescription: Middle-aged woman with curly perm, apron, hands on hips
quizzes.dialogue: Aigoo, you finished eating! How would you like to pay?

choices.text: Let's split it. I'll pay for what I ordered.
Let's divide the total equally among everyone.
I got this one! You can get the next round.

quizzes.wrongFeedback: In Korea, someone usually treats the whole table! 'I got this one' is the way.
quizzes.correctFeedback: Perfect! Treating others is a big part of Korean dining culture!

quizzes.npcDescription: Young person in uniform, tired eyes, one earbud in
quizzes.dialogue: That'll be 4,500 won. Do you need a bag?

choices.text: No thanks, I brought my own. *pulls out eco-bag*
*Wait silently for them to pack it*

quizzes.wrongFeedback: Plastic bags cost extra in Korea! Locals always carry eco-bags.
quizzes.correctFeedback: Nice! You're already living that eco-friendly Korean lifestyle!

quizzes.npcDescription: Elderly woman in full hiking gear, visor, vest, hiking poles
quizzes.dialogue:
*You're standing near the priority seats on a crowded subway*
*An elderly woman is sitting, but she's staring at you...*
*She sighs loudly* "Hmph... young people these days..."

What do you do?

choices.text: Offer her your non-priority seat nearby
Avoid eye contact and pretend to be on your phone
Ask if she needs help with anything

quizzes.wrongFeedback: She already has a seat! She might need help with directions or her bags. Koreans often help elders proactively.
quizzes.correctFeedback: Excellent! Proactively helping elders is deeply respected in Korea!

transformation.title: Tongue Transformation!
transformation.description:
The tiger can no longer pronounce 'TH'!
"Three" → "Seuree"

quizzes.npcDescription: Man in wrinkled suit, red face (slightly drunk), loosened tie, holding soju bottle
quizzes.dialogue:
Yah! First round is over. Let's go to second round!
*It's 11 PM. You have an early flight tomorrow.*

What do you say?

choices.text: Sorry, I really need to go. I have plans tomorrow.
Sure! Where are we going next?
*Check your watch and hesitate* "Umm... maybe just one more..."

quizzes.wrongFeedback: Leaving early? Bold move. In Korean work culture, 회식 (team dinners) are sacred. The correct answer is enthusiastic participation!
quizzes.correctFeedback: That's the spirit! 회식 (hoesik) culture is all about team bonding!

quizzes.npcDescription: Trendy young person, bucket hat, oversized vintage tee, tote bag
quizzes.dialogue:
Hey! We're planning a road trip this weekend.
Don't you NOT like jjimjilbang (Korean spa)?

*You actually LOVE jjimjilbang and want to go!*

How do you respond?

choices.text: Jjimjilbang is weird, not in this lifetime.

quizzes.wrongFeedback: Tricky! In Korean logic, 'Don't you NOT like X?' - answering 'No' means 'No, that's wrong, I DO like it!'
quizzes.correctFeedback: You've mastered Korean double-negative logic! 'No' = 'That's incorrect, I DO like it!'

transformation.title: Final Transformation!
transformation.description: The tiger now bows 20 times a day!
